meanings.definition: A position or direction in which someone or something faces or moves
meanings.sent1: She stood by my side during the entire performance.
meanings.sent2: The sun sets on the western side of the house.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to walk on the side of the road instead of the middle.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty never wavered, always staying by my side like a faithful companion.
meanings.sent5: The side of the mountain was covered in lush green trees, creating a beautiful view.

meanings.definition: One of the two surfaces of a flat object
meanings.sent1: The shiny side of the mirror reflected her image clearly.
meanings.sent2: He wrote his name on the side of the paper.
meanings.sent3: The side of the table was scratched from years of use.
meanings.sent4: The artist carefully painted each side of the canvas with intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The smooth side of the tile felt cool to the touch.

meanings.definition: A group that is opposing or in conflict with another group
meanings.sent1: The two sides of the debate presented their arguments passionately.
meanings.sent2: The rival sides clashed in a fierce competition.
meanings.sent3: The side of the room supporting the new policy cheered loudly.
meanings.sent4: The sides in the negotiation were at a stalemate, unable to reach an agreement.
meanings.sent5: The opposing sides finally found common ground and resolved their differences.

meanings.definition: A particular aspect or feature of something
meanings.sent1: The creative side of her personality shone through in her artwork.
meanings.sent2: The business side of the project required careful planning and budgeting.
meanings.sent3: The humorous side of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dark side of the story revealed a shocking twist.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the historical side of the city was both educational and fascinating.
